description: 37-min interview about trust in business, two speakers. Contains 6 extractable segments covering trust gap, AI marketing, producer mindset, Copernican shift, human-in-the-loop philosophy, and benefit-driven marketing. Originally the LLM proposed 2 poor segments; these 6 were manually curated by reviewing the transcript with verified sentence boundaries.

ground_truth.summary: The Trust Gap - closing the trust deficit in business relationships
ground_truth.rationale: Cold open from ~12:31 (trust gap soundbite), then chronological body covering how trust is built through consistent content. ~60s raw.

ground_truth.summary: AI Marketing - efficiency vs brand trust tradeoff
ground_truth.rationale: Cold open teaser from ~16:44, then discussion of AI's role in marketing and why it can undermine trust. ~55s raw.

ground_truth.summary: Stop consuming and start thinking like a producer
ground_truth.rationale: Cold open with strong opinion from ~34:24, then producer mindset discussion. ~59s raw.

ground_truth.summary: Jobs To Be Done / Copernican Shift - the user's problem is the sun
ground_truth.rationale: Cold open with Copernican metaphor ('earth revolves around the sun = the user's problem'), then body covering the jobs-to-be-done framework and the shift from feature-first to problem-first marketing. All cuts verified at sentence boundaries. ~49s raw.

ground_truth.summary: Human in the loop / Anti-AI-slop philosophy
ground_truth.rationale: Cold open with 'humans have inherent value' statement, then body covering why Marky keeps humans in the loop and rejects full AI automation. Discusses the vision problem of AI-generated content and why the tool should amplify, not replace. All cuts verified at sentence boundaries. ~73s raw.

ground_truth.summary: Benefit-driven marketing - lead with the outcome, not the feature
ground_truth.rationale: Cold open with concrete example of flipping 'AI content creator' to 'save time with...', then body covering the principle of benefit-driven marketing and why features don't sell. All cuts verified at sentence boundaries. ~74s raw.
